question: If H is the head available for a hydraulic turbine, the power, speed and discharge, respectively are proportional to

Which of the following advantages is/are possessed by a Kaplan turbine over a Francis turbine?
A. Low frictional losses.
B. Part load efficiency is considerably high.
C. More compact and smaller in size.
Select the correct answer using the codes given below.
The diameter of the turbine runner varies as

answers.a: Square of power for the given head
answers.b: Square of discharge for the given speed
answers.c: Square root of the speed for given head
answers.d: Square root of the head for given speed

question: The cavitation in reaction turbines is avoided, to a great extent by

answers.a: Using stainless steel runner of the turbine
answers.b: Installing the turbine below the tail race level
answers.c: Providing highly polished blades to the runner

question: Specific speed of the hydraulic turbine is defined as the speed of such a turbine

answers.a: It consumes unit discharge under unit speed
answers.b: It consumes unit discharge to develop one metric HP
answers.c: It develops one metric HP under unit head
answers.d: It runs at unit speed under unit head
